p: However, existing research shows that service staff are rarely equipped to meet those needs. A study among staff in Canada found that when accessing health and harm reduction services, people with experience of intimate partner violence encounter stigmatising or victim-blaming attitudes [ 55]. Under-resourced staff, both in terms of training and high caseloads, reduces the likelihood that intimate partner violence will be addressed [ 58]. The lack of services for people with experience of intimate partner violence is an unmet need in harm reduction services.
